column4: Hello -- I have something that is going to sound stupid..  I have two of the same notebook computers.  One runs XP and the other Ubuntu 9.10.. For some reason the one running ubuntu 9.10 gets a low wireless signal.   I thought maybe it was hardware so I swapped hard drives between the two (Same exact hardware) and no atter what, the one running XP gets a more reliable wireless signal.
Do you think an OS has anything to do with signal strength though??
Check if your notebook turned up.  Something things get wired backward and require little configurations.
Run "sudo lshw -c network" and paste it.
Have you tried the backport modules?
Okay. Try this. "sudo aptitude install linux-backports-modules-karmic" -- When it's finished, reboot and come back.  Your wifi should be working fine without any dropped connections.
No problem. Next time you have problem, look up on your wifi card.  You have AR928X. :)
That way, I can read highlighted messages easily.
It is where any new features or non-security bugfixes will be coming in.
If your Wifi does not work, it's not OS, it's the kernel. :O
Well I don't want to bug you too much...  You seam to keep yourself pretty busy without my help....  You have a great day and a happy new year if i don't run into you before then.
I'm glad to help people out. I have to RTFM on search engines to read and review stuffs. Solutions too.  Enjoy your freedom from wired connections. :)
I am never the first to run into the problem so the answers is usually in the ubuntu forums..:)
Wireless is a dirty word..  :) I work in the wire and cable industry!! :) heheheeheheh
